page.title: 12ATTITUDES
page.content: 'Tranent by-pass is given the 'go- ahead' was the headlines in a local newspaper.It should be operational by 1976.The newspaper was dated 1973. Twelve years on the dream becomes a reality - but the original proposal was put forward more than twenty years ago.A survey on local shops showed that nearly all thought that the by- pass would make little difference to trade.New housing schemes have increased volume of trade.This is not the case of the residents of Glen Heugh cottage,TRANENT.While the by- pass does not directly affect them the link road was planned to pass through their property. The cottage used to belong to the station master. The railway was the first wooden railway in Scotland.At a public enquiry a petition was presented to save the cottage.No decision was made.
